name: datastream
doc:
Resources classes are used by rest.li to process corresponding HTTP request.
 Note that rest.li will instantiate an object each time it processes a request.
 So do make it thread-safe when implementing the resources.

generated from: com.linkedin.datastream.server.dms.DatastreamResources

finders.name: findGroup
finders.doc:
Find all the datastreams in the same group as the provided {@code datastreamName}
 This finder method can be invoked via /resources/datastream?q=findDuplicates&datastreamName=name

actions.name: getTaskAssignment
actions.doc: Finds the task's assignment node which hosts the given task

actions.name: movePartitions
actions.doc:
Move partitions to a particular host
Service Returns: Result HTTP status

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.doc: partitions that need to move to

parameters.name: targetHost
parameters.doc: target host to accommodate the partitions

parameters.name: notify
parameters.doc:
specify if we should notify the leader to start process the assignment, we can stage the update
               and batch it later by setting it into false

actions.name: pause
actions.doc:
Pause a datastream
Service Returns: Result HTTP status

parameters.name: force
parameters.doc: whether or not to pause all datastreams within the given datastream's group

actions.name: pauseSourcePartitions
actions.doc: Given datastream and a map representing <source, list of partitions to pause>, pauses the partitions.

parameters.name: sourcePartitions
parameters.doc:
StringMap of format <source, comma separated list of partitions or "*">. 
Example: <"FooTopic", "0,13,2"> or <"FooTopic","*">

actions.name: resume
actions.doc:
Resume a datastream
Service Returns: Result HTTP status

parameters.name: force
parameters.doc: whether or not to resume all datastreams within the given datastream's group

actions.name: resumeSourcePartitions
actions.doc: Given a datastream and a map representing < source, list of partitions to resume >, resumes the partitions.

parameters.name: sourcePartitions
parameters.doc:
StringMap of format <source, comma separated list of partitions or "*">.
                         Example: <"FooTopic", "0,13,2"> or <"FooTopic","*">

actions.name: stop
actions.doc:
Stop a datastream
Service Returns: Result HTTP status

parameters.name: force
parameters.doc: whether or not to resume all datastreams within the given datastream's group
